This deal reflects rising NBA salaries. It highlights the challenges of balancing value and cost in the league.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nba/top-stories/san-antonio-spurs-229-million-gamble-why-deaaron-foxs-landed-one-of-the-nbas-most-overpaid-contracts/articleshow/123292117.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nba/top-stories/san-antonio-spurs-229-million-gamble-why-deaaron-foxs-landed-one-of-the-nbas-most-overpaid-contracts/articleshow/123292117.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 06:35:11 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>RAUNAK BOSE</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="39160" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123292170,imgsize-39160.cms"/></item><item><title>Life in jail, Rs 10 lakh fine: Uttarakhand conversion bill gets stringent</title><description><![CDATA[Uttarakhand's cabinet approved a stringent amendment to the Freedom of Religion Act, targeting forced conversions with penalties up to life imprisonment and a ₹10 lakh fine. The bill, expected to pass in the upcoming assembly session, increases jail terms and allows arrests without warrants.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/life-in-jail-rs-10-lakh-fine-uttarakhand-conversion-bill-gets-stringent/articleshow/123291964.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/life-in-jail-rs-10-lakh-fine-uttarakhand-conversion-bill-gets-stringent/articleshow/123291964.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 06:16:22 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>KAUTILYA SINGH</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="981885" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123292017,imgsize-981885.cms"/></item><item><title>Dadar Kabutarkhana row escalates into Jain–Marathi manus face-off</title><description><![CDATA[Tensions flared in Mumbai as Marathi Ekikaran Samiti members protested the Jain community's demand to continue pigeon feeding at Dadar Kabutarkhana. Hundreds were detained after protesting remarks by a Jain monk who threatened action if the practice was banned.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/dadar-kabutarkhana-row-escalates-into-jainmarathi-manus-face-off/articleshow/123278964.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/dadar-kabutarkhana-row-escalates-into-jainmarathi-manus-face-off/articleshow/123278964.cms</guid><pubDate>Wed, 13 Aug 2025 16:05:01 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>RICHA PINTO</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="120474" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123278960,imgsize-120474.cms"/></item><item><title>Nasa intern Thad Roberts stole $21m in moon rocks from Johnson Space Center for love</title><description><![CDATA[In 2002, Thad Roberts, a NASA intern, stole moon rocks from Johnson Space Center. He was aided by Tiffany Fowler and Shae Saur. The stolen rocks were valued at $21 million. Roberts claimed it was for love, but the FBI found he planned to sell them. Roberts and his accomplices were arrested. The heist damaged scientific research.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/nasa-intern-thad-roberts-stole-21-million-in-moon-rocks-from-johnson-space-center-for-love-shocked-the-world/articleshow/123286064.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/science/nasa-intern-thad-roberts-stole-21-million-in-moon-rocks-from-johnson-space-center-for-love-shocked-the-world/articleshow/123286064.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 00:01:00 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI SCIENCE DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="31684" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123286254,imgsize-31684.cms"/></item><item><title>India acts minimally, Pakistan rarely acts against rights abuses: US</title><description><![CDATA[The US government released a human rights report noting abuses in India and Pakistan. The report stated India took minimal steps to combat abuses. Pakistan rarely took credible steps. The report documented instances in 2024. Rights groups fault Narendra Modi's government for its treatment of minorities. India denies discrimination and says its policies benefit everyone.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-acts-minimally-pakistan-rarely-acts-against-rights-abuses-us/articleshow/123290045.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/india-acts-minimally-pakistan-rarely-acts-against-rights-abuses-us/articleshow/123290045.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 02:38:30 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1644192" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123290051,imgsize-1644192.cms"/></item><item><title>Lab-grown rabies antibodies show promise as safe alternative</title><description><![CDATA[A recent clinical trial, funded by a pharmaceutical company and published in The Lancet, suggests a lab-made rabies immunoglobulin could replace animal and human-derived versions in India's public hospitals. This shift promises a safer, more affordable option for preventing rabies after dog bites.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/lab-grown-rabies-antibodies-show-promise-as-safe-alternative/articleshow/123290787.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/lab-grown-rabies-antibodies-show-promise-as-safe-alternative/articleshow/123290787.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 04:22:49 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>ESHAN KALYANIKAR</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1375861" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123290825,imgsize-1375861.cms"/></item><item><title>Supreme court ends IMA case against Patanjali on misleading ads</title><description><![CDATA[]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-ends-ima-case-against-patanjali-on-misleading-ads/articleshow/123290067.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/sc-ends-ima-case-against-patanjali-on-misleading-ads/articleshow/123290067.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 02:51:25 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TNN</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="2166722" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123290071,imgsize-2166722.cms"/></item><item><title>Taylor Swift on New Heights: Patrick Mahomes says ‘They called Brittany’; post-show FaceTime buzz</title><description><![CDATA[Taylor Swift's 'New Heights' debut created buzz. This highlights the Mahomes-Kelce-Swift connection. The episode included Swift's album announcement. Mahomes found himself amidst pop culture's excitement. He anticipates more such moments in the future.]]></description><link>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/didnt-call-me-they-called-brittany-patrick-mahomes-on-taylor-swift-and-travis-kelces-post-new-heights-facetime/articleshow/123289705.cms</link><guid>https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/sports/nfl/news/didnt-call-me-they-called-brittany-patrick-mahomes-on-taylor-swift-and-travis-kelces-post-new-heights-facetime/articleshow/123289705.cms</guid><pubDate>Thu, 14 Aug 2025 01:21:59 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>GLOBAL SPORTS DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="1679820" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-123289707,imgsize-1679820.cms"/></item><item><title>In a 1st in India, Goa to negotiate lower prices for life-saving therapies</title><description><![CDATA[Goa pioneers a groundbreaking pricing policy to enhance access to costly cancer and rare disease treatments.       <description><![CDATA[The overall market grew 8.4%, its fastest pace since 2022, driven by a replacement cycle as support for Windows 10 ends later this year and customers front-load purchases.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[India-China direct flights resumption likely to boost trade, tourism and economic ties]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/india-china-flights-resumption-economic-ties-impact-19653647.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[India and China are set to resume direct passenger flights after five years, a move expected to boost trade, tourism, and economic ties. The resumption comes amid growing diplomatic engagement, recent trade approvals, and ahead of Prime Minister Modi’s visit to China for the SCO Summit. Pre-pandemic, over 8 lakh passengers traveled annually between the two countries, with cargo flows also significant. Restoring direct flights is likely to reignite strong demand, supporting business, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Wed, 13 Aug 2025 23:52:07 +0530]]></pubDate>
      <dc:creator>Swapnil Deshpande</dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/india-china-flights-resumption-economic-ties-impact-19653647.htm]]></guid>
      <category><![CDATA[Business]]></category>
      <media:content height="675" width="1200" medium="image" url="https://images.cnbctv18.com/uploads/2024/03/china-india.jpg"/>
    </item>

      <description><![CDATA[The inspection was carried out from August 4 to August 13, 2025. The company said the inspection ended with four observations, with no data integrity-related remarks. Shares of Zydus Lifesciences Ltd ended at ₹989.05, up by ₹32.95, or 3.45%, on the BSE.]]></description>

      <title><![CDATA[Pilot poaching: Is India's request valid?]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/aviation/pilot-poaching-is-indias-request-valid-19653640.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[On average in India, a senior First Officer earns about ₹5 lakh a month. At Emirates or Etihad, it’s ₹10 lakh rupees, tax-free, plus free housing and free schooling for up to 3 children. In the US, the same job can get you ₹17 lakh a month. That's almost two and a half times what they get in India.]]></description>

      <title><![CDATA[Dashverse to invest $13 million Series A funding in AI R&D to build India’s leading creator ecosystem]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/startup/dashverse-series-a-funding-ai-powered-tools-dashreels-creator-ecosystem-india-19652864.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Dashverse, an AI-driven entertainment startup, is set to invest 60-70% of its recent $13 million Series A funding into advanced AI research and development. With its microdrama app Dashreels surpassing 5 million downloads in just a month and ranking third on the Google Play Store, the company aims to build India’s leading AI creator ecosystem. CEO Sanidhya Narain highlighted the goal of delivering seamless storytelling through AI, tackling challenges like character consistency. Beyond consumer apps, Dashverse also offers AI-powered tools to help creators produce serialised content, aiming to democratise content creation via a thriving two-sided marketplace.]]></description>

      <category><![CDATA[Business]]></category>

      <title><![CDATA[Barclays Hurun 2025 Ranking: Top 10 women leaders steering India’s most valuable family businesses]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/photos/business/top-10-women-leaders-steering-most-valuable-family-businesses-in-india-roshni-nadar-bina-modi-barclays-hurun-2025-ranking-19652564.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Women at the helm of India’s most valuable family-run businesses are redefining leadership and legacy. Armed with vision, resilience, and strategic acumen, they are steering enterprises that shape the nation’s economy across technology, industry, healthcare, and manufacturing. The 2025 Barclays Private Clients Hurun India Most Valuable Family Businesses List celebrates these leaders, whose influence reaches far beyond boardrooms, proving that gender is no barrier to commanding some of the country’s most powerful corporate dynasties.]]></description>
